bibl.title: Letter from James E. Peabody to John J. Moran, December 10, 1935

div1.p: Peabody thanks Moran for his hospitality and for the information on the yellow fever commission work.

div1.head: Letter from James E. Peabody to John J. Moran, December 10, 1935

opener.dateline:
James Edward Peabody
442 Henkel Drive
Winter Park, Florida
December 10, 1935.

div1.p:
I cannot begin to express the debt we owe to you for
your generous hospitality, and for all you contributed to
our pleasure while we were there. It was a great experience fo
for me to hear direct from you the story of those momentous
days of 1900. I am especially glad to be able to correct
some of the impressions I have been holding, especially to
receive the corrected copy of the American Museum pamphlet.
I am sure I ought not to have accepted from your hands that
discharge certificate and the letter from the Surgeon General.
I am therefore returning them for your safe keeping. They
are most interesting reading; I am glad to have seen them, and
when I go through Washington on my return north I shall try to
see General Kean and tell him of my great days in Havana.

I have already sent the Biology book, which I trust will
reach you safely. We enjoyed meeting Mrs. Moran, and we feel
pleased indeed that she could join us at lunch and at the even-
ing lecture. Your presence added greatly to the interest of
the gathering.

Mrs. Peabody joins me in sending kindest regards and
best wishes to you both.
div1.closer: Always sincerely yours, James E. Peabody.
